Described Disease.Described Disease: Inherited bone marrow failure syndrome with impaired ribosomal biogenesis

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using fibroblasts from patients.

Readout description.Result Description: Fibroblasts harboring the variant showed a significant decrease in RPL29 protein levels, assessed by Western blot.

Biological replicates.Description: The experiment was performed three times (biological replicates).

Technical replicates.Description: Two independent experiments were performed for each sample (technical replicates).

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type RPL29 cDNA was transfected into the fibroblasts as a control.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein levels found to be within normal range.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant decrease in RPL29 protein levels.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: significant reduction in overall protein synthesis
Readout description.Result Description: Fibroblasts harboring the variant showed a significant reduction in overall protein synthesis, as measured by [radiometric assay].

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Control fibroblasts were used as a comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in overall protein synthesis.
